org.judal.storage

Class Env

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.judal.storage.Env

  • public class Env
extends java.lang.Object

    Helper methods to read properties from environment to create data sources and other objects.

    The list of recognized properties and their default values are kept as static variables at org.judal.storage.DataSource class
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergio Montoro Ten

      • getDataSourceDefault

        public static java.lang.String getDataSourceDefault(java.lang.String propertyName)

        Get default value for a property (if present).

        Parameters:
        propertyName - String
        Returns:
        String Default property value or null if property has no default value.

      • getDataSourcePropertiesFromServletConfig

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDataSourcePropertiesFromServletConfig(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                                                                        java.lang.String namespace)
                                                                                                 throws java.lang.ClassCastException

        Read DataSource properties from ServletConfig parameters into a Map DataSource property names names are listed at DataSource.PropertyNames

        If namespace is not empty then parameter names will be read as namespace.parameterName
        Parameters:
        obj - ServletConfig
        namespace - String
        Returns:
        Map containing the property name as key and its value at ServletConfig or a default value taken from DataSource interface static variables
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If obj is not an instance of class javax.servlet.ServletConfig

                                                                                throws java.io.IOException

        Read DataSource properties from a properties input stream into a Map If namespace is not empty then property names will be read as namespace.parameterName

        Parameters:
        inStrm - InputStream
        namespace - String
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oProperties,
                                 java.lang.String sVarName,
                                 boolean bDefault)

        Get the value of a property that represents a boolean type.

        Parameters:
        oProperties - Map<String,String>
        sVarName - Property Name
        bDefault - Default Value
        Returns:
        If no property named sVarName is found at sProfile then bDefault value is returned. If sVarName is one of {true , yes, on, 1} then return value is true. If sVarName is one of {false, no, off, 0} then return value is false. If sVarName is any other value then then return value is bDefault

      • getPath

        public static java.lang.String getPath(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oProperties,
                                       java.lang.String sVarName)

        Get a property representing a file path.

        This method ensures that a file separator is always appended to the end of the readed value.

        Parameters:
        oProperties - Map<String,String>
        sVarName - Property Name
        Returns:
        Value terminated with a file separator or null if no property with such name was found.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oProperties,
                                         java.lang.String sVarName,
                                         java.lang.String sDefault)

      • getPositiveInteger

        public static int getPositiveInteger(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> oProperties,
                                     java.lang.String sVarName,
                                     int iDefault)

        Get a property representing a positive integer value.

        This method ensures that a file separator is always appended to the end of the read value.

        Parameters:
        oProperties - Map<String,String>
        sVarName - Property Name
        iDefault - int
        Returns:
        Value terminated with a file separator or null if no property with such name was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
